title: What is a person who invents technology? - Quora

response.answer_text: Could be a pain in the arse! The inventor as the English language becomes in itself a language and dictionaries to be. The question could then be who invented the inventor, and therefore another language that may mean the translation is Producer. There is an interesting fact of defining words and then attributing that definition, that other countries may disagree by the history of what the word occurred, in an easement of being able to comment. If a canon blasts a town away is the inventor around to say Hooray or quietly changing the word into Slave Repairer of the Masters Plans-Promsman. Technology itself is a modern word, considering that this word is at the end of what a language could offer in the respect of what it means-so ergo-Convener-then a convenor can occur. One thing is for sure-inventing an App is not easy to get a sole ownership of the invention- as the use of tools being-so, Partner Inputs As- it may end up-PIA. lj

Depends where you are coming from on it. Engineers do R&D work. Fabricating Engineers do the creating. Technicians tell the Fabs and the R&D people why it failed to work or, in extreme cases, blew up. But I think if you’re looking for somebody who can pull various strands together of what’s currently possible and make the concept of something new out of it, the term you are looking for is “Technologist”. At least it is in the UK.
